column4: I made a hello world C program following a tutorial.  When I try to run it by typing ./myprogram I get an error: "cannot execute binary file"  do I need to provide a path to whatever runs binary files, or something....??
what was the file extension for the program u made and compiled?
no extension.   I just tried this:  sudo ./myprogram and received an error ./hw: 1: Syntax error: word unexpected (expecting ")")     <-- Does this mean it is running...?
i mean, trying to run, and the program itself has the error  (rather htan not running at all)
i guess i should also mention that "myprogram" is actually called "hw"
it sounds like the program its self might have a error
okay! that's good news  (well, relative to it not being able to run anything)  I'll go tinker with it.  Thanks.
im not sure if thats it but it sounds like that could be the problem
I pasted my error and the line of code, if that gives any hints: http://pastie.org/1014104
im going to compile and run it to see if its ur ubuntu box or the program
the -c compile flag is only if its multiple files
i just looked irc and saw what you said and yay its fixed! i gcc helloworld.c -o hw then sudo ./hw and it worked
do you happen to know a good way to get shell scripts to produce an output? maybe to get them to write to file if they error?
im not really good with any type of programing except for some c and perl, so no.
sudo is running a command as root like sudo apt-get
